column5: I need to get you the Walleye Taco breading I concocted this year for your trip. Bold but not overpowering. If anybody else wants it....... it's not a closely guarded secret.
This trip was worthy of a separate thread. http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...mi-6516-61116/
You really did it now Bill. I know for certain that I want to fish with you, after seeing how you guys eat. Very nice pictures and report !

Thanks Keith, we do eat well, but it is only 113$/man for 6 days. I'd sure like to see someone eat off a 113$ budget at disneyland for 6 days. No sir, this thing we do..... ya just can't beat it with a stick.
That's a great trip report. Beautiful pictures. Looks like you've got a wonderful group of fun guys. I can't imagine a better way to spend a week. Thanks for sharing.

Pi keslayer, Great report and what great memories you are building. thanks for sharing your memories and I sure wonder how you can stay relatively fit with that culinary spread! Hopefully someday we can get that trip together that you and Wallydave and I were talking about a couple years ago. This fall we are flying into Luella Lake with mattice. Only 85 days from now! I hope it is at least as awesome as your trip was! Fish On! Hooks

Is a great group of guys.... We originated from Manchester Ia., your neck of the woods.Quote: Originally Posted by HeHooksHimselfPikeslayer, Great report and what great memories you are building. thanks for sharing your memories and I sure wonder how you can stay relatively fit with that culinary spread! Hopefully someday we can get that trip together that you and Wallydave and I were talking about a couple years ago. This fall we are flying into Luella Lake with mattice. Only 85 days from now! I hope it is at least as awesome as your trip was! Fish On! HooksRelatively fit.... more like relatively unfit, the skeeters don't even bite me or if they do I swear they spit. Tick tick tick............ Hooks, those last 85 days will go fast as you start (continue) your preparations. Me, I will go nuts again waiting for next year. Have an awesome trip to Luella
Well done Bill, as my grandad used to say, "more memories for the rocking chair"!Your culinary expertise is inspiring.
Thanks Mike, And trip reports produced on "Canada Fishing Talk" are definitely the way to go. Great site, I think I'm gonna frequent there more often
Yep, Bill !! GREAT pics, again ! GREAT lookin food .... AGAIN... Man, If I went with... They would charge Me an "overweight" fee upon return, I'm sure...
Hey guys, we should try to get a trip together one of these years. Thanks sharing , it helps to pass the time while I'm waiting for my trip later this season.
